column2: Greeting 1
column3: Greeting 2

column2: I'm glad I found you! Of all the other guards, you are the only one I've seen! Regnan Pirates attack the island. We must inform the caravan master, Dadeross. He's visiting the village chieftain. Find him! I'll return to the wagons to guard them.
column3: Have you spoken with Dadeross?  What are we to do now?

column2: Greetings Journeyman!  I have been speaking with Brekish Onefang about the predicament that we find ourselves in. The Clan Leader may know of a way to get off these islands and return to Ravenshore
column3: Have you found a way off the islands?  Are the waters safe for us to sail back to Ravenshore?

column2: Welcome to Dagger Wound Island, Journeyman of Alvar.  I am Brekish Onefang, Clan Leader.  I wish I was greeting you during better times.

column1: The mountain of fire has caused serious damage to my village and its people.  Many buildings have been damaged, and the bridges that connect the smaller islands to the main island have been destroyed!  Many people are missing or stranded on these smaller islands!  We must help them!"
column2: Have the Portals been fixed?  My stranded people are able to return to the safety of the village here on the main island?
You must tell the Merchants of Alvar of the Regnan raid on Dagger Wound Island!  They must send help!
column3: We are in debt to you!  Not only did you save my stranded people, but you also returned to stop the Regnan assault upon my island!

column2: What?  I don't have time to talk now!  I need to pack some things and leave!
column3: Be quick with your business. I must prepare to escape these islands!

column2: Aren't you with the Merchant Caravan from Alvar?  I need your help!
column3: The mountain of fire will surely destroy us!

column2: It's the end of the world!  The Mountain of Fire will consume us all!
column3: It's the end of the world!  The Mountain of Fire will consume us all!

column2: What are you doing here? Get my letter to Fellmoon!
column3: What are you doing here? Get my letter to Fellmoon!

column2: Welcome aboard!  May you have smooth, swift seas!
column3: Welcome aboard!  May you have smooth, swift seas!

column2: Welcome to the Ravenshore guildhouse of the Merchants of Alvar. I am Elgar Fellmoon. How may I help you?
column3: Yes?

column2: Have you done as I've asked of you?
column3: Have you done as I've asked of you?

column2: Okay…you've beaten my guards. Truce.

column1: I'm Arion Hunter. I suppose you could call this all my operation. What do you want?"
column2: What is it now?
Halt! None may pass into the inner chambers unless accompanied by a guild member.
column3: Halt! None may pass into the inner chambers unless accompanied by a guild member.

column2: Welcome to the Guildhouse of the Merchants of Alvar. I am Bastian Loudrin, the high guildmaster. From here we run the Alvarian trade empire.
column3: Welcome back to the Guildhouse of the Merchants of Alvar.

column2: We have identified those we believe would join an alliance to stand against the crisis. These are: the Minotaurs of Ravage Roaming, the Clerics of the Temple of the Sun in Murmurwoods, the Dragons of Garrote Gorge, the Necromancers' Guild in Shadowspire, and Charles Quixote's Dragon hunting camp in Garrote Gorge.

column1: Now none of us believe that you can get all of them to work together, but with us and the Trolls already with the alliance, it should suffice if three of the five join us.

Perhaps you should begin by speaking with Sahil Ittalle who lives at the north end of the town. He is our guild's historian and the best person to brief you on our potential allies' various dispositions."
column2: Good day.
I am Overdune, I hunt meat for the village of Rust. Or I did so before the lake of fire came to destroy our homes.
column3: You are back. How goes it with you?

column2: Leave me be. I morn the death of Vilebite, my son.
column3: Leave me be. I morn the death of Vilebite, my son.

column2: Th-thank you for giving my son Vilebite his rest.
column3: Come in…you are always welcome here.

column2: It is only because you are under Bastian Loudrin's protection that I have allowed you this audience. Know you stand before Deftclaw Redreaver, Ultimate Flightleader of the Dragons of Jadame. I am not to be tarried with. Speak your business!
column3: You disturb me again? This had best be important.

column2: What do you want?
column3: What do you want?

column2: Sir Charles Quixote at your service. Welcome to my camp headquarters. From here I oversee this hunting expedition.

column1: Are you here to trade? Most of what my goods are committed to orders already. I do, however, have some baby dragons for sale. And I suppose I could part with some of the lower grade adult hides."
column2: How may I help you?
You just caught me. I'm almost ready to leave for Ravenshore, but how may I help you?
column3: You just caught me. I'm almost ready to leave for Ravenshore, but how may I help you?

column2: It was a long journey, but here I am. Good to see you again.
column3: How are you?

column2: Hail the alliance! How goes it with you?
column3: Welcome!

column2: And so I have made haste to Ravenshore. Already I grow weary of life among the prey animals. You had best be quick about the business of this alliance!
column3: Well, what is it?

column2: It has been a long time since I have traveled. I forget how beautiful parts of this land can be. I look forward to resolving the current crisis--the very least reason being that I can then take a long deserved sabbatical.
column3: Yes?

column2: It is good to see you again, friends. Thanks to you, things go well at Balthazar Lair. Already my herd has made great progress towards restoring our homes and shops. Perhaps you have visited the restored city?
column3: Greetings, friends.

column2: Things go well for us in our war against the Temple of the Sun. Before I left, I saw the Shadowspire border made secure. Daily our troops force theirs back to their main temple in Murmurwoods.

column1: Again, on behalf of the Necromancers' Guild, I thank you. Now, let us get on with the business at hand."
column2: Hello, guild friends.

Greetings. I am Masul, Herdmaster of Balthazar Lair. On behalf of my herd, I thank you for saving us. I was sure that we were destined to perish. Now it seems we will survive. I look forward to rebuilding our lair.
column3: How may I serve the saviors of my herd?

column2: Wha…who is it? Who is it! You may think my injuries make me easy prey raiders! But know my axe is sharp, and…and…hey…

column1: You're not the raiders! Who are you?"
column2: Hello, again.

Hail to you. I am Sandro. Thant and I are the high guildmasters of the Necromancers' Guild. With our fortunes diminished in Erathia and Enroth, it could be argued that we speak for the guild worldwide.

column1: We have heard that you are envoys from Bastian Loudrin. What is his need of us?"
column2: What is it? Be quick! We are very busy.

Hah! The only advantage that the Sun Temple had against us is no more. With the Nightshade Brazier back in our possession, we no longer need worry about the daytime defense of Shadowspire. We can march our undead to their very doors. We will destroy their temple and wipe them from the face of Jadame!

column1: Now that the tide of battle has turned in our favor, we of the Necromancers' Guild can more generously consider the request made by our friend, Bastian Loudrin. Thant can take over here while I am away sitting on your alliance council."
column2: Yes?
Who are you? I don't recognize you, but I'm sure that whatever your business, it will add to my troubles.
column3: What do you want?

column2: So, Sandro has asked you to strike a blow against the Sun Temple! Though I hate the guild. I would be willing to help you. Half a serving of revenge is better than none.
column3: So, do we move against the Sun Temple? Shall we get for Sandro his Nightshade Brazier?

column2: Ah, you are sent by his high holiness…Oskar Tyre thinks to activate his agent. Though I would wish him no good, I will do as he asks. Yes, I have knowledge of the guild's Skeleton Transformer and believe I can destroy it. Very well, let us do this thing against the Necromancers' Guild. I will at least be able to strike against one of my enemies!
column3: Are you now ready to destroy the guild's Skeleton Transformer? I will join you and we can be about the task!

column2: Hah! So both Sandro and Oskar Tyre seek to use me against the other. I have thought of the possibility of this occurring. I believe that if I were to strike against one, it would become impossible for me to strike the other.

column1: So I guess we have a choice--help the guild or the temple. Which? I don't know, as my hatred for both is equal. I suppose I'll have to do with a half measure of revenge."
column2: So, have you decided to steal the Nightshade Brazier from the Temple, or to destroy the guild's Skeleton Transformer? Either way…I will join you. But let us do it. I would slack my thirst for revenge.
So you are sent by Bastian Loudrin? Well, then. What would he have us hear?
column3: The Light upon you. What need you of our temple?

column2: Hail, heroes of Jadame! I'm glad you’ve returned. I want to make it clear that the merchant guild has made this guildhouse permanently open to you.

column1: Now that the crisis is over, the other council members have returned home. Though they are gone, good will prevails between us. The beginning of a new era of peace? We will see. Certainly it is a time of prosperity! Our caravans are already back in operation."
column2: Hail, Heroes of Jadame!
Ah well, very good to see you. Quite a lot of trouble is behind us, no? What brings the "Heroes of Jadame" to my camp?
column3: Hello again.

column2: Together we have done a great deed. I look forward to telling my heir the tale. How can I help you, heroes?
column3: Welcome. My cave is open to you.

column2: The Light has shined upon us indeed. Our temple is always open to the "Heroes of Jadame." How may I help you?
column3: Yes, friends?

column2: How good of you to grace us with your presence. Heroes of Jadame. Saviors of Balthazar Lair. Both fitting titles for you who have done so much for me herd and for all of Jadame!
column3: Hail, Saviors of Balthazar Lair!

column2: Hail! In the name of the guild, I welcome you. Know that we consider you our friends, Heroes of Jadame. What would you have of us today?
column3: Greetings, heroes.

column2: If you're looking for my master, Xanthor, he is not here. Can I help you?
column3: Can I help you?

column2: Hmph. So you are the heroes of the alliance. Not much to look at, I must say. Still, I suppose you have survived much to see this day. I only hope you are up to the task I think fate has for you. If not, we are all surely doomed!
column3: You are back? Have you need of advice? Or are you finding the task at hand too difficult?

column2: There. It is built. Take this Conflux Key. As I have explained, it will allow you to use the crystal in the town square as a gateway--much as you've used the elemental gateways to reach the elemental planes. The crystal gateway will take you to the place between the planes.

column1: On this ""Plane Between Planes"" you must find the source of the cataclysm. What it is, I don't know, but whatever it is, it is there. Go now! The fate of the land, I'm afraid, lies on your shoulders. Be worthy of the task!"
column2: You must go through the crystal gateway! It leads to the plane between planes. The cause of the cataclysm lies through it--seek out the source!
You have conducted yourselves greatly. I must say I had my doubts about your abilities, but no longer. You are truly worthy of the praise that all lavish upon you.
column3: How can I help you, friends?

column2: I sense some small presence in this chamber. Greater than gnats, but so much less than myself. Where is it….

column1: Ah, there it is. What have we here? Some of the beings of Jadame? Yes. Destroy them? Surely within my rights…but, no. It has been a slow millennia. Perhaps they will provide some diversion.
Speak then, lower ones! What would you have of Escaton the Destroyer of Worlds?"
column2: Ah the gnatlings are returned. I must consider why I allow them their continued existence. But this I will do some other time.

column1: Speak then, while you still may, puny ones."
column3: Escaton

column2: Greetings.  You seek instruction?
column3: Good day.  You seek to gain knowledge?

column2: Who is there? Am I finally to be released?
column3: Are you here to free me?

column2: Help me! I have been able to live thus far, but for how much longer can I?
column3: Will you now release me from my torment?

column2: Ah, mortals…good. You are not of my tormentors. Release me from this place! I will not harm you.
column3: Release me from this cell, mortals!

column2: Free me quickly! I have survived so far, but it is only a matter of time before I am extinguished!
column3: My fires dampen. Release me!

column2: Greetings. I am Sahil Ittalle, the historian of the Alvarian Merchant Guild. How can I help you today?
column3: Yes? Can I help you?

column2: Ah, you must be the alliance council's heroes. Well met. Catherine and I are here to help. What can I do for you?
column3: Greetings!

column2: It was a harrowing journey to reach your shores, I assure you! But the events of the cataclysm force all to extreme duties. I'm sure you understand. But down to issues. How can I help you?
column3: Yes?

column2: Greetings! I am Asael Fromago, the world's preeminent connoisseur of fine cheeses. Oh, some might say that Elkanah Juusto of Edenbrook holds the title, but he is a dilettante--a mere dabbler!
column3: Greetings! How may Asael Fromago, master of cheeses, serve you?

column2: Hail, adventurer!
column3: Hail, adventurer!

column2: Yeah? What do you want?
column3: Yeah? What do you want?

column2: How are you today?
column3: How are you today?

column2: Yes? What is it?
column3: Yes? What is it?

column2: Greetings. How may I help you?
column3: Greetings. How may I help you?

column2: Who are you? Clearly you are not of this realm. And how have you survived? I am amazed you have not been destroyed by the madness that has taken over my fellow earth dwellers!
column3: Good to see you again.

column2: Greetings. Though I have not yet succumbed to the madness, be aware! I feel its tug on my mind. I don't know how long I can hold out.
column3: Hello again. You are still safe in my presence. The madness has not overtaken me.

column2: The madness pulls at me, but still I maintain my sanity. If you have business with me, speak quickly. Even now I feel a compulsion to attack you!
column3: I am still in my own mind, but for how long I don't know. What do you want?

column2: Fear not, plane-travelers. For reasons I do not understand, the madness that affects my brethren does not affect me. How can I help you?
column3: Yes?

column2: Madness reigns these watery realms, but it does not rule me. Somehow I am not affected. How can I help you?
column3: How can I help you?

column2: T-the madness p-pulls at my very soul. Each day is a st-struggle to maintain sanity. I w-will h-help you while I c-can, but be prepared to fl-flee!
column3: I s-still maintain my-myself. W-what is it y-you want?

column2: Welcome to my sanctuary. I have proofed this chamber against the maddening magic which affects my fellow citizens. You are safe as long as you stay here. How may I help you?
column3: How can I help you?

column2: I don't know what has befallen us, but it is awful! All my friends and family are affected by violent madness. Somehow I am not affected. But how can I help you?
column3: Hello again.

column2: So, I understand you're out for adventure. I'd be glad to join you!
column3: Welcome back! Have you decided to take me with you in your travels?

column2: It is so boring around here! I mean, why did I spend all that time training if I'm not going to use my skills? Say, perhaps you could take me with you. Clearly you're headed someplace exciting!
column3: So, have you come back to take me on your adventure?

column2: I know the elder Dragons would never approve, but I don't care! I want adventure, and you're the best chance I'll see. Can I go with you?
column3: So, can I come with you now? Can I?

column2: Would you believe the Necromancers' Guild cast me out? I, Karanya Memoria? Fah! They were just jealous of my great potential. Not that this has stopped me from seeking dark knowledge--I do so now by my own path.

column1: Say, perhaps we could join forces!"
column2: Hello.

Greetings, travelers! Ah, how I envy your lives of adventure. You know, I too know the call of the open road. I myself once sought new experiences--strange lands, strange people, and whatnot. Sadly, those days are over for me.
column3: Good to see you again!

column2: Greetings, and well met! I am Jasp Thelbourne--an Elf of daring deeds. This is no idle boast. You may have heard of the Idol of Seven Skunks? It was I who recovered it from the Temple of Eep for the Alvarian Merchant Guild.
column3: Hello, again. How can Jasp Thelbourne, renowned adventurer do for you?

column2: I grow weary of the endless demands placed on my by my so-called "master," the accursed Thant. He would have me stay here in Shadowspire as a guard. A "guard," feh! I am meant for greater things. An adventure like yours is what I seek. Will you have me in your fellowship?
column3: Well, I'm still here, but I make preparations to leave as soon as an opportunity presents itself. Have you reconsidered? Will you take me now?

column2: Greetings. I am Nathaniel Roberts. Without false modesty, I can say I am a mighty master of dark magic. It is your good fortune I have grown bored of Shadowspire and seek a company of adventurers such as yourselves to ally myself with. If you are agreeable, I will allow you to accompany me.
column3: So, you have reconsidered my offer. Will you now agree to become my followers?

column2: So, a party of "adventurers"…hmmm. I suppose most dragons would just attack them outright, but then again I, Flamdring, have never been "most dragons," no. Join them? Yes, perhaps I will. Perhaps I will.
column3: Ah the adventurers return. Again the question arises: To join them or no? Yes, perhaps so…

column2: How are you? I am Hevatia Deverbero, a member in full standing of the Necromancers' Guild.
column3: Hello, again.

column2: Greetings, and may the Light shine on you. What can a humble priest of the Sun do for you today?
column3: Hello again. May the Light shine on you.

column2: Yes? Well, don't stand there tongue tied! I'm a busy man!
column3: What do you want?

column2: Hello, and good hunting to you. I am Sethrc Thistlebone, a warrior of this village, such as it is.
column3: Hello, and good hunting!

column2: Greetings. Welcome to my home. I am Rionel, axe warrior of Balthazar Lair.
column3: Welcome to my home.

column2: Greeting! I am Adric Stellare, a former lieutenant of the Alvar Guard. I grew tired of the regimented lifestyle. Now I seek adventure.
column3: Greetings!

column2: I am Infaustus, elder vampire and adventurer. I will talk with you if you are brief. I am busy making preparations to leave. I go to seek my fortune across the lands of Jadame.
column3: Yes?

column2: Very impressive performance. Reaching me was not easy. Perhaps you are the adventurers I seek. You see, I wish to explore the world, and these days, even a Dragon would be smart not to travel alone.
column3: Yes?

column2: Hail, adventurers! I am Tempus, hunt leader and a knight of some renown in my native Erathia. What can I do for you?
column3: Hail!

column2: Greetings! I am the mighty Thorne Understone. I know we have not met before--I never forget a face--but perhaps you recognize my name from ballads. You know, several have been written about me.
column3: Hello again. What can the mighty Thorne do for you? Maybe I could sign my name on your shield as a keepsake. A lot of my fans seem to like that sort of thing.

column2: Hail! I am Ulbrecht, a hero of the Vori campaigns. Be welcome in my home.
column3: It is good to see you again.

column2: I wake after a sleep of thirty-four years, and already I have company! I see you have traveled far. Perhaps you can tell me what has transpired while I slumbered.
column3: Greetings.

column2: I am Duroth the Eternal. By besting the guards you have earned the right of speaking to me. What do you want?
column3: What brings you again to Duroth the Eternal?

column2: Greetings! I am Weldrick Falconeye, Dragon training specialist. What can I do for you today?
column3: Hello again…need any Dragons trained?

column2: Greetings.
column3: Hello, again.

column2: Sethrik Fist at your service. Fine coffins made to order.
column3: Hello, again.

column2: The call of madness it burns…burns! My mind…ahrgg! Wait! A moment of clarity…quickly! State your business! I can hold out for but a moment.
column3: What…is…it…you…w-want?

column2: Hail, adventurer!
column3: Hail, adventurer!

column2: Ahoy, matey!
column3: Ahoy, matey!

column2: What do you want? My research requires great concentration--a concentration you are breaking with you're intrusion!
column3: You again? What is it?

column2: What do you want?
column3: What do you want?

column2: Are you the new recruits? Of course you are! Why else would you be seeking me out? I'm ex-Captain Terrence, here to help you on your way to becoming proper Regnan sailors.
column3: Ah, the new recruits again! What can I do for you?

column2: How are you? What can a simple fisherwoman do for you today?
column3: How are you? What can a simple fisherwoman do for you today?

column2: Hello?  Ah, someone else who seeks a way off this accursed island!  My name is Simon Templar!  I found my way into this temple as I was told it was the way out!  Let's travel together!
column3: Hello?  Ah, someone else who seeks a way off this accursed island!  My name is Simon Templar!  I found my way into this temple as I was told it was the way out!  Let's travel together!

column2: Greetings, do you seek guidance from the Light?
column3: Greetings, do you seek guidance from the Light?

column2: Nooo!  What…where am I? You rescued me?  My thanks!!
column3: Nooo!  What…where am I? You rescued me?  My thanks!!

column2: Welcome!  I can make many wondrous things from the various ores that are indigenous to Jadame.
column3: Welcome!  I can make many wondrous things from the various ores that are indigenous to Jadame.

column2: Halt! These areas are off limits to guests! Guild members only!
column3: Halt! These areas are off limits to guests! Guild members only!

column2: You may not enter here, puny ones! Stand back or become our prey!
column3: You may not enter here, puny ones! Stand back or become our prey!

column2: Halt! Only members of our knightly brotherhood may pass this point. Others who attempt to pass will face our wrath!
column3: Halt! Only members of our knightly brotherhood may pass this point. Others who attempt to pass will face our wrath!

column2: Stop! You may not enter the storeroom!
column3: Stop! You may not enter the storeroom!

column2: Hail! I'm Jeric Whistlebone. Welcome to my camp. We're on a hunting safari. You're welcome to look around, but don't interfere with our operation. This is no place for amateur fumbling about!
column3: Hello, again.

column2: You are back? Have you need of advice? Or are you finding the task at hand too difficult?
column3: You are back? Have you need of advice? Or are you finding the task at hand too difficult?

column2: Greetings. I am the Oracle of Jadame. The mysteries of the Hidden World are open to me. Through long years of training, I have gained a small measure of control over time and space. I can reach my hand through the void and bring things to me--both items and knowledge.
column3: Greetings, and may the Balance always tilt in your favor.

column2: Halt! Only guild members and their guests can pass this point. Further, any guild members with you must be at least, conscious. You have old Leland with you, but he's in no condition to oversee you.
column3: Halt! Only guild members and their guests can pass this point. Further, any guild members with you must be at least, conscious. You have old Leland with you, but he's in no condition to oversee you.
